author: Greg Dailey
title: PHOTOS: Northern Lights seen Thursday night in parts of Kansas City
text:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (KCTV) - The northern lights were on display across several states Thursday night, and amateur photographers across the Kansas City area went outdoors to catch them on camera.
Doug Zubenel captured the below images from De Soto.
Northern Lights seen in De Soto, Kansas. (unknown | Doug Zubenel) Northern Lights seen in De Soto, Kansas. (unknown | Doug Zubenel) DeeDee Arps took these photos below of the Aurora Borealis as seen in Blue Springs.
Northern Lights from my front yard on 10/10/24 at 9:10pm in Blue Springs, MO. (DeeDee Arps) Northern Lights from my front yard on 10/10/24 at 9:10pm in Blue Springs, MO. (DeeDee Arps) Catina Green captured this image of the Northern Lights from Lawson, Missouri.
The Northern Lights seen in Lawson, Missouri. (Catina Green) Lori Jo Jensen took some photos of the Northern Lights about 9:30 p.m., 20 miles north of Kansas City.
Northern Lights at about 9:30, 20 miles north of Kansas City. (Lori Jo Jensen) Northern Lights at about 9:30, 20 miles north of Kansas City. Tonalea Rehmer also saw the Aurora Borealis in Smithton, Missouri.
Aurora south of Smithton, Missouri. (Tonalea Rehmer) To view more or submit your own photos, click here .

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: March Madness Star: McNeese State's Amir Khan Goes Viral!
text:
March Madness Star: McNeese State’s Amir Khan Goes Viral!
Amir Khan, a student manager for McNeese State's basketball team, gained unexpected fame when he rapped along to his favorite song before a game, leading to a viral video that captivated audiences and garnered nearly 200,000 views. As McNeese State prepares for the NCAA Tournament as a No. 12 seed against Clemson, Khan reflects on his journey from a passionate fan to the first known student manager to secure NIL deals with brands like Buffalo Wild Wings and Insomnia Cookies, highlighting the transformative impact of March Madness on his life.
- Khan's pre-game rap video amassed nearly 200,000 views.
- McNeese State is entering the NCAA Tournament for the second consecutive year.
Khan's viral fame and NIL deals represent a shift in how student managers can gain recognition, yet it also raises questions about the commercialization of college sports and the balance between supporting athletes and managers.
State of Play- McNeese State is riding an 11-game winning streak heading into the tournament.
- Khan has turned his social media presence into tangible endorsements, enhancing team morale.
As the Cowboys face Clemson, Khan's rising profile may influence other student managers to pursue similar opportunities, possibly leading to more NIL deals across college sports.
Bottom LineAmir Khan's journey illustrates the evolving landscape of college athletics, where even student managers can achieve significant recognition and financial success, reshaping the traditional roles within college sports.
Read more at Sportsnet.ca

author: Winnie Onyando
title: 10 ways to be a better employee in 2024
text:
In the ever-evolving landscape of the professional, being an exceptional employee extends far beyond the boundaries of routine job tasks.
It requires actively contributing to the creation of a vibrant and collaborative work atmosphere.
Do you want to be acknowledged as the employee of the year?
Well, this is possible. You just have to cultivate a new mindset.
Here are 10 actionable ways to enhance your professional contributions and thrive in the workplace:
Cultivate continuous learning
Albert Einstein once said, “When you stop learning you start dying”. The brain is like a muscle – the more it is used, the stronger it gets. People better use it to learn new skills to adapt themselves to what’s coming their way. Yes, I agree with him. For you to be a better employee in 2024, you have to embrace a growth mindset by staying updated on industry trends and acquiring new skills.
Attend workshops, webinars, or online courses to enhance your knowledge and expertise. Don’t just stay in the office throughout.
Enhance communication skills
Effective communication is key in any workplace. Hone your verbal and written communication skills, ensuring clarity and precision in your interactions with colleagues, clients, and superiors.
You can record yourself talking just to see how good or poor you are in communication. Be one who always goes for the best.
Prioritize time management
Efficiently manage your time to meet deadlines and accomplish tasks.
Utilize productivity tools, create to-do lists, and prioritize tasks to ensure you’re consistently delivering high-quality work.
Reduce your gossip time and when you go for lunch, don’t sit pretty but eat fast and get back to work.
Embrace adaptability
The professional landscape is ever-evolving. Demonstrate adaptability by being open to change, embracing new technologies, and adjusting your approach to meet the evolving needs of your role.
Don’t stay rigid. If you don’t adopt change, then you will be elbowed in the marketplace (work/office).
Foster collaboration
Actively seek opportunities to collaborate with colleagues from various departments. Cross-functional collaboration not only enhances creativity but also contributes to a positive and interconnected workplace culture.
Initiate solutions
Instead of merely identifying problems, be proactive in suggesting and implementing solutions. Showcase your problem-solving abilities and demonstrate a commitment to the success of your team and the organization.
Seek feedback and act on it
Solicit constructive feedback from peers and supervisors to identify areas for improvement. Use this feedback as a tool for personal and professional development, showcasing your commitment to growth.
Demonstrate leadership qualities
Leadership is not restricted to titles. Exhibit leadership qualities by taking initiative, motivating your team, and acting as a positive influence in the workplace.
Maintain a positive attitude
Cultivate an optimistic outlook, even in the face of challenges. A positive attitude not only enhances your well-being but also contributes to a more uplifting and productive work environment.
Build and leverage networks
Actively build professional networks within and outside your organization. Networking opens up opportunities for collaboration, mentorship, and career advancement, enhancing both your personal and professional growth.
By incorporating these habits into your professional life, you’ll not only become a better employee but also contribute to a thriving and collaborative workplace culture in 2024 and beyond.

author: Par La Presse
title: Tunisie: Alerte santé - Le ministère dévoile les risques des aliments ultra-transformés - allAfrica.com
text:
Dans un communiqué officiel, le ministère de la Santé a lancé une alerte concernant les dangers des aliments ultra-transformés, appelant les citoyens à adopter une alimentation plus saine et consciente.
Ces produits, omniprésents dans nos assiettes, sont définis comme des aliments ayant subi une transformation industrielle intensive, auxquels sont ajoutés des ingrédients artificiels tels que des colorants, des arômes, des conservateurs et des édulcorants.
Le ministère met en garde contre des exemples familiers : les pizzas et burgers des fast-foods, les boissons gazeuses, les jus industriels, les confiseries emballées, les biscuits ou encore les viandes transformées comme le salami ou les merguez.
Ces aliments, bien qu'attractifs par leur praticité et leur goût, sont directement liés à de nombreux problèmes de santé.
Le ministère souligne qu'une consommation régulière augmente le risque d'obésité, de diabète, de maladies cardiovasculaires et même de certains cancers.
En cause : leur richesse en graisses saturées, en sucres et en sel, qui perturbent l'organisme, et leur pauvreté en nutriments essentiels comme les vitamines, les minéraux et les fibres.
Ces déficits nutritionnels peuvent affaiblir le système immunitaire et nuire à la santé digestive, rendant le corps plus vulnérable face aux maladies.
Le ministère invite aussi les citoyens à privilégier les aliments naturels comme les fruits, les légumes et les produits frais. Il recommande également de préparer ses repas à la maison pour mieux contrôler la qualité des ingrédients.
Enfin, il encourage chacun à lire attentivement les étiquettes des produits alimentaires, afin d'éviter ceux qui contiennent des additifs artificiels.
« Votre santé commence par vos choix alimentaires », insiste le ministère dans son communiqué, rappelant que chaque décision compte pour bâtir une société en meilleure santé.
L'alerte est lancée : il est temps de revoir nos habitudes pour protéger notre bien-être et celui de nos familles.
Lire l'article original sur La Presse .

author: none@none.com (AFP)
title: US calls on Israel to be ‘transparent’ on Gaza school strike
text:
WASHINGTON: The United States called Thursday on Israel to be transparent over a strike on a UN school in Gaza, including on whether children were killed.
“The government of Israel has said that they are going to release more information about this strike, including the names of those who died in it. We expect them to be fully transparent in making that information public,” State Department spokesman Matthew Miller told reporters.
The Israeli military said it carried out a precision strike on a Hamas compound inside the school run by the UN agency for Palestinian refugees UNRWA.
Israel says jets strike school containing Hamas compound, Gaza media says 27 killed
Miller said the United States believed Israeli assessments that Hamas has at times hidden in civilian infrastructure, but said it was waiting for information on the latest strike.
“We’ve seen the claims that 14 children were killed in this strike, and certainly, when you see – if that is accurate – that 14 children were killed, those aren’t terrorists,” he said.
